lyapunov¶

rescomp.measures.lyapunov(reservoir, threshold=10, plot=False, print_switch=False, test_measure=False)¶

Calculates the maximal Lyapunov Exponent of reservoir.y_pred (or reservoir.y_test), by estimating the time derivative of the mean logarithmic distances of former next neighbours. Stores it in reservoir.lyapunov (reservoir.lyapunov_test) Only values for tau_min/max are used for calculating the slope!

Since the attractor has a size of roughly 20 [log(20) ~ 3.] this distance reaches a maximum after a certain time, approximately after 4. time units [time_units = dt*steps] Therefore the default values are choosen to be dt dependent as in ###Definition of taus:

tau_min/max are given in units of steps plot to check for correct average
